greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = a(1) = 0, and for n > 1, a(n) = number of iterations of A238525 (n modulo sopfr(n)) needed to reach either 0 or 1. Here sopfr(n) is the sum of the prime factors of n, with multiplicity, A001414.
comment: Previous name was: Recursive depth of n modulo sopfr(n), where sopfr(n) is the sum of the prime factors of n, with multiplicity.
Indices of records are 0, 2, 8, 22, 166, ... (A238530) - _David A. Corneth_ & _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 20 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16384
formula: a(0) = a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = 1 + a(A238525(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 20 2017
example: a(2) = 1, because 2 mod sopfr(2) = 2 mod 2 = 0, and further recursion (0 mod sopfr(0)) is undefined.
a(8) = 2, because 8 mod sopfr(8) = 8 mod 6 = 2, and 2 mod sopfr(2) is defined as above, giving 8 a recursive depth of 2.
mathematica: Array[-1 + Length@ NestWhileList[Mod[#, Total@ Flatten@ Map[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # &, FactorInteger@ #]] &, #, # > 1 &] &, 105, 0] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 20 2017 *)
program: n = n % sum([f[0]*f[1] for f in factor(n)])
results.author: _J. Stauduhar_, Feb 28 2014
ext: Terms a(0) = a(1) = 0 prepended and name changed by _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 20 2017
